tool.name: FROGS Phyloseq Import Data

param.name: biomfile
param.label: Biom file
param.help: The file contains the OTU's informations (format: biom1).

param.name: samplefile
param.label: Sample tsv file
param.help: The file contains the samples's informations (format: tabular).

param.name: treefile
param.label: Tree file
param.help: The file contains the tree's informations (format: Newick - nhx or nwk).

param.name: ranks
param.label: Names of taxonomics ranks
param.help: The ordered taxonomic ranks levels stored in BIOM. Each rank is separated by one space.
param.value: Kingdom Phylum Class Order Family Genus Species

param.name: normalization
param.label: Do you want to normalize your data ?

tool.help:
.. image:: ${static_path}/images/tools/frogs/FROGS_logo.png :height: 144 :width: 110
.. class:: infomark page-header h2
What it does
Launch Rmardown script to import data from 3 files: biomfile, samplefile, treefile into a `phyloseq <https://joey711.github.io/phyloseq/>`_ object.
.. class:: infomark page-header h2
Inputs/Outputs
.. class:: h3
Input
**OTUs biom file**:
The OTUs biom file (format `biom1 <http://biom-format.org/documentation/format_versions/biom-1.0.html>`_). These file is the result of FROGS. The example of biom file:
.. image:: ${static_path}/images/tools/frogs/biomfile.png :height: 30 :width: 733
**Newick file** (tree.nwk):
Newick file (format `nxh <https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Newick_format>`_). The result of FROGS Tree:
.. image:: ${static_path}/images/tools/frogs/nwk_treefile.png
**Sample file**: The file contains the conditions of experiment with sample ID in the first column:
.. image:: ${static_path}/images/tools/frogs/phyloseq_samplefile.png :height: 115 :width: 369
.. class:: h3
Output
**Html file** (format `HTML <https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/HTML>`_): The summary of phyloseq object.
.. image:: ${static_path}/images/tools/frogs/phyloseq_import_data_html.png
**Data file** (format rdata): The informations of data in one phyloseq object.
.. class:: infomark page-header h2
